Jessica's tiny house "Rustica Retreat" is a charming and clean space with more than enough room for the two of us and our infant.
The setting is just out of town on their hobby farm, and the house is parked on the other side of the yard from the house which provides privacy. There are animals around, including horses, a donkey, a dog, a cat, and ducks. Jessica and her family work around the property during the day and provide you as much distance as you need, and are quite friendly if you want to chat. The southern-facing entrance with comfy chairs are inviting at the end of the day.
The expectations and directions given by Jessica are spot-on, and instructions on how to use the composting toilet were clear and accurate. I worked remotely through video calls and VPN access (10/10 internet speed and service) for the week while we visited family in the area. I'm not sure I'd recommend this space for mobile children unless they stay on the main floor on an air mattress or the couch as there is no railing on the attic-style bed. The mattress is the most comfortable I've slept on, and there is enough space for someone just under 6' to sit up on the bed. There are plenty of windows for a cool breeze at night and a very effective heater/AC unit above the kitchen counter that cools the entire place down in minutes. (I'll assume seasonally) they have a farm stand with veggies and duck eggs just behind the house.
Next time we're back in Platteville, we'll be contacting Jessica and I'd encourage you to do the same. Thanks Jessica!
